questions.question_text:
Which of the following statements about lines of authority and reporting are true?
1. The Project Manager has day-to-day control for a management stage within the limits laid down by the Project Board.
2. If a Team Manager forecasts a deviation beyond Work Package tolerances, this should be referred to the Project Manager.

discussion.content: Both 1 and 2 are correct, the PM manages the world within their thresholds, and the same for the team manager. If there is a issues outside of the tolerances, it goes from Team manager to PM, then to exception reports and to the board.

Which is a FALSE statement about technical stages?

discussion.content: Technical stages are more tied to work packages then stage boundaries. Think of the design of the game, its not as tied in to stage control. in this case, Technical stages can overlap management stages.

choices.B: Typified by the use a particular set of specialist skills

choices.D: Can span more than one management stage
